metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML Table Colgroup
The <colgroup> element is used to style specific columns of a table.
content.html: The <colgroup> element is used to style specific columns of a table.

content.text: HTML Table Colgroup
If you want to style the first two columns of a table, use the <colgroup> and <col> elements.
content.html: If you want to style the first two columns of a table, use the <colgroup> and <col> elements.

content.text: The <colgroup> element should be used as a container for the column specifications.
content.html: The <colgroup> element should be used as a container for the column specifications.

content.text: Each group is specified with a <col> element.
content.html: Each group is specified with a <col> element.

content.text: The span attribute specifies how many columns get the style.
content.html: The span attribute specifies how many columns get the style.

content.text: The style attribute specifies the style to give the columns.
content.html: The style attribute specifies the style to give the columns.

content.text: Note: There is a very limited selection of legal CSS properties for colgroups .
content.html: Note: There is a very limited selection of legal CSS properties for colgroups.

content.code_html:
<table>
  <colgroup>
    <col span="2" style="background-color: #D6EEEE">
  </colgroup>
  <tr>
    <th>MON</th>
    <th>TUE</th>
    <th>WED</th>
    <th>THU</th>
...

content.text: Note: The <colgroup> tag must be a child of a <table> element and should be placed before any other table elements, like <thead> , <tr> , <td> etc., but after the <caption> element, if present.
content.html: Note: The <colgroup> tag must be a child of a <table> element and should be placed before any other table elements, like <thead>, <tr>, <td> etc., but after the <caption> element, if present.

content.text: Legal CSS Properties
There is only a very limited selection of CSS properties that are allowed to be used in the colgroup:
content.html: There is only a very limited selection of CSS properties that are allowed to be used in the colgroup:

content.text: width property visibility property background properties border properties
All other CSS properties will have no effect on your tables.
content.html: All other CSS properties will have no effect on your tables.

content.text: Multiple Col Elements
If you want to style multiple columns with different styles, use more than one <col> element inside the <colgroup> :
content.html: If you want to style multiple columns with different styles, use more than one <col> element inside the <colgroup>:

content.code_html:
<table>
  <colgroup>
    <col span="2" style="background-color: #D6EEEE">
    <col span="3" style="background-color: pink">
  </colgroup>
  <tr>
    <th>MON</th>
    <th>TUE</th>
    <th>WED</th>
    <th>THU</th>
...

content.text: Empty Colgroups
If you want to style columns in the middle of a table, insert an "empty" <col> element (with no styles) for the columns before:
content.html: If you want to style columns in the middle of a table, insert an "empty" <col> element (with no styles) for the columns before:

content.code_html:
<table>
  <colgroup>
    <col span="3">
    <col span="2" style="background-color: pink">
  </colgroup>
  <tr>
    <th>MON</th>
    <th>TUE</th>
    <th>WED</th>
    <th>THU</th>
...

content.text: Hide Columns
You can hide columns with the visibility: collapse property:
content.html: You can hide columns with the visibility: collapse property:

content.code_html:
<table>
  <colgroup>
    <col span="2">
    <col span="3" style="visibility: collapse">
  </colgroup>
  <tr>
    <th>MON</th>
    <th>TUE</th>
    <th>WED</th>
    <th>THU</th>
...
